gcci.text: H100 rental rates averaging $3.17/hour signal persistent supply chain bottlenecks as AI workload demand outpaces fabrication capacity, driving CapEx escalation toward $2T annually across hyperscale infrastructure.

gtpi.text: Input token pricing at $1.25/1M reflects aggressive API price compression amid model commoditization, forcing providers to achieve 40%+ inference efficiency gains to maintain margins against open-source competition.

gagl.text: Annual AI energy consumption of 120 TWh approaches 3% of global electricity demand, creating grid stability challenges that accelerate nuclear adoption mandates while pressuring providers to achieve 25% PUE reductions.

aipi.text: Convergent cost pressures across hardware, tokens, and energy reveal growth sustainability concerns as the industry's $500B capex cycle faces margin compression from price wars, suggesting selective consolidation toward vertically integrated players.
